name: Timezone Scheduler
description: This module is intended to facilitate scheduling with support for multiple client timezones

project-settings.name: Configuration instance for each reservable appointment slot

sub_settings.name:
Slot Project ID
Enter the project_id that contains database of reservation slots. The project must match the required project format (i.e. use the template to create new slot projects)

Slot ID Field
Field in this project that will hold the reserved appointment slot once selected by a user

Slot ID Field Event
The event id where the Slot ID Field above resides.
(If you wish to use the same Slot Id Field in a form that is enabled on multiple events, you must create a configuration instance for each event)

Slot DateTime Field
(Optional) Select a date/time field here and the selected slot's date/time (in server timezone) will be stored. This can be used to automate reminders via notifications. The field must be in the same event specified above

Slot Participant Formatted Date
(Optional) Select a text field and the nicely formatted date and time with timezone will be stored. This could be inserted into a reminder email so the participant can see the appointment time in their selected timezone

Slot Record URL
(Optional) This field will contain a URL to the Slot Project for this slot ID. Useful for an admin to be able to jump to the Slot database.

Filter Expression
(to be developed) -- idea is that you could enter expression here that would be evaluated with the record's data and could be used to select a subset of available slots in the other database...

Disable
Check to disable this config without deleting it

project-settings.name:
Enable Debug Logging
(optional) Requires installation and configuration of emLogger

system-settings.name: Enable Debug Logging (system-wide)(optional) Requires installation and configuration of emLogger
